Module org.nasdanika.diagram
Package org.nasdanika.diagram

Interface Note

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject, org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Notifier
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NoteImpl
    public interface Note
extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject
    A representation of the model object 'Note'.

    The following features are supported:

    • Text
    • Content
    • Placement
    See Also:
    DiagramPackage.getNote()

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        String getText()
        Returns the value of the 'Text' attribute. Note text. Can be empty for notes where text is supplied by the ``content`` reference. If not empty - precedes the content elements.
        Returns:
        the value of the 'Text' attribute.
        See Also:
        setText(String), DiagramPackage.getNote_Text()

      • setText

        void setText​(String value)
        Sets the value of the 'Text' attribute.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value of the 'Text' attribute.
        See Also:
        getText()

      • getContent

        org.eclipse.emf.common.util.EList<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> getContent()
        Returns the value of the 'Content' containment reference list. The list contents are of type EObject. Composite note content to support having links. Elements shall be of type Link of Exec.content.Text.
        Returns:
        the value of the 'Content' containment reference list.
        See Also:
        DiagramPackage.getNote_Content()

      • getPlacement

        NotePlacement getPlacement()
        Returns the value of the 'Placement' attribute. The default value is "Right". The literals are from the enumeration NotePlacement. Note placement for diagram elements. Ignored for connections.
        Returns:
        the value of the 'Placement' attribute.
        See Also:
        NotePlacement, setPlacement(NotePlacement), DiagramPackage.getNote_Placement()

      • setPlacement

        void setPlacement​(NotePlacement value)
        Sets the value of the 'Placement' attribute.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value of the 'Placement' attribute.
        See Also:
        NotePlacement, getPlacement()
